Llama.description: Defines the color variant of the llama CustomMob (e.g., creamy, white, brown, gray), used for appearance customization. When this value is not set, the color will be applied randomly (like it would by spawning a normal llama).

Zombie.description: Determines whether the zombie CustomMob can break doors. This option is used to configure hostile behavior against villages or structures.

Tameable.description: Stores the unique identifier (UUID) of the player who "owns" the tameable CustomMob. The "tamed" option must also be toggled on for the mob to actually be "owned" by a player. The player will remain the owner even after a username change.
Indicates if the entity has been tamed by a player (true/false).

ChestedHorse.description: Determines whether the horse CustomMob has a chest attached (true/false), enabling additional storage. This option will only work on "horses" that can have a Chest (Donkeys, Mules).

Pig.description: Specifies the variant of the pig CustomMob, such as normal or a biome-specific type. When this value is not set, the variant will be based on the biome it is spawned in (like it would by spawning a normal pig).

Wolf.description: Sets the dye color of the wolf CustomMob's collar. The wolf needs to be tamed and have an owner in order to have the collar rendered (see Tameable option).

Indicates whether the wolf is in an aggressive (angry) state. Typically, an angry wolf will have red eyes but will not attack the players unless they attack it. If you wish that the wolf mobs attacks the players by themselves, see Special > Aggressive.

Specifies the variant of the wolf CustomMob, such as normal or a biome-specific type. When this value is not set, the variant will be based on the biome it is spawned in (like it would by spawning a normal wolf).
Indicates if the wolf should be equipped with armor.

Cat.description: Determines the breed or appearance of the cat CustomMob (e.g., tabby, siamese, black).
Sets the dye color of the cat CustomMob's collar. The cat needs to be tamed and have an owner in order to have the collar rendered (see Tameable option).

Creeper.description: Represents the cooldown time (in ticks) before the creeper CustomMob explodes when it is near a player.
Represents the distance (in block(s)) that the nearest player needs to be from the creeper CustomMob for it to explode.
Indicates whether the creeper is charged (electrified), making its explosion more powerful.

Cow.description: Specifies the variant of the cow CustomMob, such as normal or a biome-specific type. When this value is not set, the variant will be based on the biome it is spawned in (like it would by spawning a normal cow).

HappyGhast.description: Represents the harness equipped on the happy ghast CustomMob.

SkeletonHorse.description: Indicates whether the skeleton horse is a trap variant (spawns skeleton riders when triggered by player(s) nearby).

Ageable.description: Specifies whether the entity is a baby (true/false), affecting size and behavior. If left unset, the CustomMob's age will be randomly chosen (like the default behavior of minecraft mob spawning).

Axolotl.description: Indicates the color variant of the axolotl CustomMob (e.g., pink, gold, cyan, blue). If left unset, the color will be chosen randomly.

Steerable.description: Indicates if the entity (like a pig or strider) has a saddle and can be ridden.

Panda.description: Describes the genetic trait (gene) of the panda CustomMob (e.g., lazy, aggressive, playful), influencing its behavior.

Villager.description: Indicates the biome-based appearance of the villager CustomMob (e.g., plains, desert, jungle).
Specifies the CustomMob villager’s job or role (e.g., farmer, librarian, blacksmith).

Special.description: Toggles the visibility of the entity's name tag, even when not directly looking at it. If not set, the name of the CustomMob will be shown when looking at the mob (default behavior).
Sets the entity's health (in half heart(s)). A health of 20 means that the CustomMob has 10 hearts of health.
Indicates whether the entity is in an aggressive state, which means that they will attack any nearby player (even if the mob is normally passive).
Toggles the glowing effect around the entity.
When enabled, allows the entity to pick up dropped items.
Indicates how far the entity is knocked back when hit (a high value indicates that the CustomMob should not go far).
Controls the movement speed of the entity. The default value is 0,3.
Defines the range of damage the entity can inflict. For a mob to inflict exactly "x" damage every time, set the lower and higher bounds of the range to the same "x" value.
When enabled, prevents the entity from taking any damage.
MWhen enabled, mutes all sounds made by the entity.
Determines whether the entity is affected by gravity or not.
When enabled, keeps the entity from despawning naturally.
Specifies whether the entity uses advanced AI behaviors (such as moving around, attacking, etc.).
Sets the range at which the entity can detect and follow targets. The default value is 32.
Adjusts the entity’s physical size. The default value is 1.
Toggles whether the entity drops default loot on death.

Replaces a percentage of the naturally spawned mobs of the CustomMob's type. For example, if this value is set to 25% and the CustomMob's type is a Cow, 1/4 of the naturally spawned cows will be replaced by this CustomMob. <li>Multiple CustomMobs of the same type with this option enabled will increase the percentage accordingly.

Frog.description: Specifies the variant of the frog CustomMob, such as normal or a biome-specific type. When this value is not set, the variant will be based on the biome it is spawned in (like it would by spawning a normal frog).

PigZombie.description: Indicates the anger duration (in ticks) of a zombified piglin, which states for how long the zombified piglin will try to attack the player.

Parrot.description: Specifies the color variant of the parrot (e.g., red, blue, green). If left unset, the color will be chosen randomly.

Fox.description: Specifies the variant of the fox CustomMob, such as normal or a biome-specific type. When this value is not set, the variant will be based on the biome it is spawned in (like it would by spawning a normal fox).

Horse.description: Specifies the base color of the horse CustomMob. If left unset, the color will be chosen randomly.
Specifies the pattern or markings of the horse CustomMob. If left unset, it will be chosen randomly.
Represents the armor item equipped on the horse CustomMob.

Vindicator.description: Represents whether the vindicator CustomMob should attack almost all entities (as when vindicators are renamed "Johnny").

Rabbit.description: Sets the appearance or breed of the rabbit CustomMob (e.g., black, brown, white, Toast). If left unset, the type will be chosen randomly.

Shulker.description: Determines the dye color of the shulker CustomMob's shell. If left unset, the color will be the purple-ish (default) one.

Chicken.description: Specifies the variant of the chicken CustomMob, such as normal or a biome-specific type. When this value is not set, the variant will be based on the biome it is spawned in (like it would by spawning a normal chicken).

Slime.description: Integer value indicating the size of the slime CustomMob (affects health and split count).

AbstractHorse.description: Determines how high the horse CustomMob can jump. The default value is 0.7. When left unset, the jump strength will be randomly chosen.
Indicates whether the horse is equipped with a saddle.

Sittable.description: Determines whether the CustomMob entity is currently in a sitting state.
